channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There are temporary traffic lights on the junction of manor road and runnings road. There is no permitted work here accordingly to the glos highways website. Get them removed asap!!, 26th October
item.description:
There are temporary traffic lights on the junction of manor road and runnings road. There is no permitted work here accordingly to the glos highways website. Get them removed asap!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement tarmac does not meet with our boundary fence, 26th October
item.description:
We recently moved into 177 Hatherley Road and have had to remove a hedge which fronted the property as it had grown out of control and parts were dead. We are replacing the hedge with a fence along the front boundary. When the pavement was previously tarmacked it was only done up to the overgrown hedge and now the hedge has been removed, this leaves a large gap between the new fence and the tarmac. This could be a trip hazard as the pavement is used constantly. We reported this earlier and the pavement to the east side of our driveway was fixed (looks like a temporary fix as the tarmac is being eroded by footfall already ) but the pavement to the west side of the driveway was overlooked by the surveyor. ie, no white lines were painted on the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 25th October
item.description:
Litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Lay-by on the A40 between Wheatstone Inn and Liddington Road (before you go under the railway bridge) next to the litter bin. The 'What 3 Words' location is herb.closer.salad The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.87699, -2.197851 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0304

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on Warden Hill Road towards centre line, 25th October
item.description:
What3words is next.bats.often Large pothole that requires vehicles to swerve close to the other side of the road or very close to the kerb to avoid damaging vehicles wheels. Have noticed this pothole for around 2 weeks and is getting bigger each day, potential of risk of injury to pedestrians that may cross due to this being a school area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Warden Hill Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are several blocked drains on Sandy Lane (deeply caked up, not just superficial blockage of grille), so not functioning as drains at all. There is also a drain on the mini roundabout at junction with Greenhills Rd that was fully silted up (I dug a lot of it out at dawn today but as traffic became active it wasn’t safe to continue). In heavy rain the blocked drain on the roundabout causes local flooding on the roundabout and the blocked drains on Sandy Lane mean that water has to flow in larger volume, veering into Withyholt Park which overwhelms the drains and threatens partial flooding of the properties. Please could you send a team to dig out these drains (safely) so that they can function as drains again. Many thanks in advance., 25th October
item.description:
Several drains on Sandy Lane towards the Greenhills Rd end and a drain on the mini roundabout at the junction of these roads

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Sandy Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
